chunk_00001.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm interior lighting with natural light from windows.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: dark-colored sweater - jeans - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated
Rachel Green: light-colored top - dark pants - long, wavy brown hair - smiling
Phoebe Buffay: dark top - dark pants - curly blonde hair - smiling
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - relaxed
Joey Tribbiani: light-colored shirt - dark pants - short, brown hair - smiling
Ross Geller: dark vest over white shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - serious

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
The group is gathered around a central table, engaged in conversation. Monica gestures animatedly while speaking, Rachel smiles and listens, Phoebe leans forward with interest, Chandler sits back with arms crossed, Joey leans in with a smile, and Ross appears serious and focused on the discussion.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)
- Wooden table (center of frame)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Menu board (behind counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses a coworker with Monica. The conversation has a casual tone, with Ross appearing serious and Monica animatedly responding. The others listen attentively, with Rachel smiling and Joey leaning in.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed.
chunk_00001.subtitles: [CAR HORNS HONKING] There's nothing to tell. It's just some guy I work with. Come on. You're going out with a guy. There's gotta be something wrong with him. So does he have a hump and a hair piece?
chunk_00001.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

chunk_00002.subtitles: Wait. Does he eat chalk? I don't want her to go through what I went through with Carl. Oh. Okay, everybody relax. This is not even a date. It's just two people going out to dinner and not having sex. Sounds like a date to me. I'm back in high school, in the middle of the cafeteria... ...and I realize I'm totally naked. - Oh, yeah. - I've had that dream. Then I look down and I realize there is a phone... ...there. - Instead of... - That's right! MONICA: That one, I've never had. PHOEBE: No. All of a sudden, the phone starts to ring. And it turns out it's my mother. Which is very, very weird because she never calls me. Hi. This guy says "hello," I wanna kill myself.

chunk_00003.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with decorative wall art and a visible coffee bar.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**

Monica Geller: light-colored jacket - white top - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated, gesturing
Ross Geller: dark blue jacket over red shirt - light-colored pants - dark, short hair - serious, gesturing
Phoebe Buffay: denim jacket - dark pants - blonde, long straight hair - concerned, listening
Chandler Bing: dark jacket over white shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - relaxed, smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross Geller enters the scene holding an umbrella and a coffee mug, walking toward the couch where he sits down. Monica Geller is seated on the couch, gesturing animatedly while speaking to Ross. Phoebe Buffay sits beside Ross, listening intently and occasionally gesturing. Joey Tribbiani is seated in a green armchair, holding a blue mug and smiling. Chandler Bing is seated on the couch, leaning back with arms crossed, observing the conversation.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table)

- Wooden table (with magazines and papers)
- Brick wall decor (background)

- Blue mug (held by Joey)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross Geller discusses Carol moving out with Monica Geller. The conversation has a tense tone, with Ross appearing serious and Monica animatedly reacting. Phoebe Buffay listens with concern, while Joey Tribbiani and Chandler Bing observe the interaction with relaxed expressions.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Ross Geller enters the frame and sits down on the couch.
Monica Geller gestures while speaking to Ross.
Phoebe Buffay sits beside Ross and listens.
Joey Tribbiani holds and drinks from his mug throughout.
Chandler Bing leans back in his chair, observing the conversation.
chunk_00003.subtitles: This guy says "hello," I wanna kill myself. Are you okay, sweetie? I feel like someone grabbed my small intestine, pulled it out of my mouth... ...and tied it around my neck. - Cookie? Carol moved her stuff out today. PHOEBE & JOEY: Oh. - Let me get you some coffee. - Thanks. Ew. Unh. No. No, don't! Stop cleansing my aura. Just leave my aura alone, okay? I'll be fine. All right? Really. I hope she'll be very happy. - No, you don't. - No, I don't. To hell with her. She left me! And you never knew she was a lesbian. No! Okay? Why does everyone keep fixating on that? She didn't know. How should I know? Sometimes I wish I was a lesbian.
chunk_00003.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

chunk_00004.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Monica Geller: light-colored jacket - beige pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - animated
Ross Geller: dark blue jacket over red shirt - white pants - short, dark hair - serious
Rachel Green: denim vest over patterned top - light-colored pants - long, blonde hair - smiling
Chandler Bing: light-colored shirt with dark vest - dark pants - short, brown hair - relaxed
Joey Tribbiani: dark leather jacket - blue jeans - dark, medium-length hair - smiling
Phoebe Buffay: light-colored top - dark pants - long, blonde hair - smiling

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green enters wearing a white wedding dress and veil, surprising the group. Monica Geller approaches her, smiling and gesturing warmly. Ross Geller sits on the couch holding a yellow mug, looking at Rachel with a concerned expression. Chandler Bing sits in a green armchair, holding a blue mug and gesturing as he speaks. Joey Tribbiani sits on a bar stool, reading a magazine. Phoebe Buffay sits on the couch, looking at Rachel with a smile. The group reacts to Rachel's appearance, with Monica comforting her and the others looking on.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: various colors (on table and in hands)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden table with newspapers and magazines
- Bar stools (in foreground)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Menu board (behind counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses wanting to be married again and having a million dollars with Monica Geller. The conversation has a casual, joking tone, with Rachel appearing excited and Monica reacting with concern. The group listens, with Ross Geller looking serious and Chandler Bing smiling.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel Green enters the scene wearing a wedding dress
Monica Geller approaches Rachel Green
Ross Geller looks at Rachel Green with a concerned expression
Chandler Bing gestures while speaking
Joey Tribbiani sits on a bar stool reading a magazine
Phoebe Buffay sits on the couch looking at Rachel Green
chunk_00004.subtitles: Did I say that out loud? All right, Ross. Look, you're feeling a lot of pain right now. You're angry. You're hurting. Can I tell you what the answer is? Strip joints! Come on, you're single. Have some hormones. See, but I don't want to be single, okay? I just wanna be married again. And I just want a million dollars! Rachel? Oh, God, Monica! Hi! Thank God! I went to your building and this guy with a hammer said... ...that you might be here, and you are. - Can I get you some coffee? - Decaf. Okay, everybody, this is Rachel, another Lincoln High survivor. This is everybody. This is Chandler and Phoebe... ...and Joey. And remember my brother, Ross? - Sure! - Hey. - Hi. - Oh, God.
chunk_00004.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

chunk_00005.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Central Perk coffee shop — daytime, warm ambient lighting with natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: white wedding dress - veil with floral headpiece - long, brown hair down - expression: animated, concerned
Ross Geller: dark blue jacket over red shirt - light-colored pants - dark, short hair - expression: serious, attentive
Monica Geller: light-colored jacket over white shirt - beige pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression: concerned, engaged
Phoebe Buffay: denim jacket - long, blonde hair - expression: concerned, listening intently

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel Green sits on the orange couch, gesturing expressively while speaking to Ross Geller, who sits beside her holding a yellow mug. Monica Geller and Phoebe Buffay sit nearby, listening intently with concerned expressions. Ross Geller occasionally gestures with his hands as he listens to Rachel.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: yellow (held by Rachel), dark (on table)
- Orange couch (center of frame)
- Wooden tables and chairs (background)
- Brick wall decor (background)
- Menu board (behind counter)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel Green discusses her wedding-day anxiety with Ross Geller, expressing her confusion and discomfort about her feelings toward her fiancé Barry. The conversation has a tense, serious tone, with Rachel appearing distressed and Ross reacting with concern. Monica and Phoebe listen with worried expressions.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
None observed — all characters remain seated throughout the clip.
chunk_00005.subtitles: - Hi. - Oh, God. [SIGHS] So you wanna tell us now, or are we waiting for four wet bridesmaids? Oh, God! Well, it started about a half-hour before the wedding. I was in this room with all the presents... ...and I was looking at this gravy boat. This really gorgeous Limoges gravy boat. When all of a sudden... Sweet 'N Low? - I realized... ...I was more turned on by this gravy boat than by Barry. Then I got really freaked out, and that's when it hit me: How much Barry looks like Mr. Potato Head. You know, I mean, I always knew he looked familiar, but... Anyway, I just had to get out of there, and I started wondering: "Why am I doing this?" And "Who am I doing this for?" Anyway, I just didn't know where to go, and I know you and I have drifted apart... ...but you're the only person I know in the city.
chunk_00005.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

chunk_00006.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — daytime, bright natural light from windows
The room features purple walls, a colorful patterned couch, a wooden TV stand, and a blue kitchen area visible in the background.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: white wedding dress - veil with floral headpiece - long, brown hair down - expression shifts from concerned to animated
Monica Geller: white t-shirt - beige overalls - dark, shoulder-length hair - expression animated, gesturing
Ross Geller: red jacket - light-colored pants - dark, short hair - expression serious, then amused
Chandler Bing: white shirt - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - expression amused, then laughing
Joey Tribbiani: black leather jacket - dark pants - dark, medium-length hair - expression amused, then laughing
Phoebe Buffay: light-colored top - dark pants - blonde, shoulder-length hair - expression concerned, then amused

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel, dressed in a wedding gown, stands in the kitchen area holding a phone, appearing distressed as she speaks. Monica sits on the couch, gesturing emphatically while talking to Rachel. Ross, Chandler, and Joey sit on the couch, watching Rachel with amused expressions. Chandler and Joey laugh and clap when Ross suggests pushing Rachel down the stairs. Rachel walks away from the kitchen area, still on the phone, looking upset.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Coffee mugs: yellow (held by Rachel), various colors (on table)
- Television: Sony brand, displaying a French soap opera
- Patterned couch: colorful, central in frame
- Wooden TV stand: with decorative items
- Blue kitchen cabinets: visible in background
- Fruit bowl: red bowl with bananas and apples
- Mountain Dew cans: on coffee table
- Decorative items: framed pictures, plants, posters on walls

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses her wedding plans with Monica, expressing distress about not being invited to her own wedding. The group watches a French soap opera on TV, reacting with amusement to the plot. The conversation has a humorous, lighthearted tone, with Rachel appearing distressed and the others reacting with laughter and playful suggestions.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel moves from sitting on the couch to standing in the kitchen area
Ross stands up and walks toward the kitchen area
Chandler and Joey laugh and clap
Rachel walks away from the kitchen area, still on the phone
chunk_00006.subtitles: ...but you're the only person I know in the city. Who wasn't invited to the wedding. Oh, I was kind of hoping that wouldn't be an issue. [SPEAKING IN SPANISH ON TV] I'm guessing he bought her the big pipe organ... ...and she's really not happy about it. Daddy, I just... I can't marry him. I'm sorry. I just don't love him. Well, it matters to me. CHANDLER: She should not be wearing those pants. I say push her down the stairs. ALL: Push her down the stairs! Push her down the stairs! [ALL CHEER AND APPLAUD] Come on, Daddy, listen to me! It's like all of my life, everyone's always told me, "You're a shoe!
chunk_00006.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

chunk_00007.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment kitchen and living room — daytime, bright natural light from windows

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: white wedding dress - veil with large bow - long, brown hair - animated, expressive
Ross Geller: red button-up shirt over dark t-shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - concerned, listening
Monica Geller: white t-shirt with suspenders - beige pants - dark, shoulder-length hair - concerned, gesturing
Phoebe Buffay: denim jacket over dark top - long, blonde hair - surprised, leaning forward
Joey Tribbiani: dark jacket over light shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - relaxed, sitting
Chandler Bing: dark jacket over white t-shirt - dark pants - short, dark hair - relaxed, sitting

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel, dressed in a wedding gown and veil, stands in the kitchen holding a phone, speaking animatedly while gesturing. Ross stands nearby, holding a glass of juice, listening with a concerned expression. Monica sits on the couch, gesturing as she speaks to Rachel. Phoebe leans forward from the couch, looking surprised. Joey and Chandler sit on the couch, watching the interaction.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- White wedding dress (Rachel)
- Veil with large bow (Rachel)
- Phone (Rachel)
- Glass of juice (Ross)
- Red button-up shirt (Ross)
- White t-shirt with suspenders (Monica)
- Denim jacket (Phoebe)
- Couch with colorful patterned cover (center)
- Kitchen counter with blue cabinets
- Refrigerator (white)
- Microwave (black)
- Various kitchen items on shelves

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Rachel discusses her desire to be a purse or hat instead of a shoe, expressing her frustration with being told she's a shoe. The conversation has a humorous, slightly tense tone, with Rachel appearing animated and frustrated, while Ross and Monica react with concern and surprise.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel moves from standing in the kitchen to sitting on the couch.
Ross moves from standing near the refrigerator to sitting on the couch.
Phoebe leans forward from the couch to look at Rachel.
Joey and Chandler remain seated on the couch throughout.
chunk_00007.subtitles: It's like all of my life, everyone's always told me, "You're a shoe! You're a shoe! You're a shoe! You're a shoe!" Then today I stopped and said, "What if I don't wanna be a shoe? What if I wanna be a purse? You know? Or a hat?" I don't want you to buy me a hat, I am a hat. It's a metaphor, Daddy! You can see where he'd have trouble. Look, Daddy, it's my life. Well, maybe I'll just stay here with Monica. I guess we've established she's staying with Monica. Well, maybe that's my decision. Well, maybe I don't need your money. Wait! Wait! I said maybe! Okay. Just breathe, that's it. Just try to think of nice, calm things. [SINGING] Raindrops on roses And whiskers on kittens
chunk_00007.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

Ross Geller: red shirt - dark pants - dark hair - standing near doorway, holding a drink

Rachel sits on the couch, visibly upset and covering her face with her hands. Monica kneels beside her, offering comfort and speaking to her. Phoebe leans over the couch, gesturing and talking to Rachel. Chandler enters from the kitchen, holding a sandwich, and gestures animatedly while speaking to the group. Joey stands near Monica, holding a drink, and listens to the conversation. Ross enters from the doorway, holding a drink, and joins the group. The group is gathered around Rachel, who remains seated and distressed, while the others react with concern and conversation.

Chandler enters from the kitchen area

chunk_00008.subtitles: [SINGING] Raindrops on roses And whiskers on kittens Doorbells and sleigh bells And something with mittens La la la something With string I'm all better now. I helped. MONICA: Look, this is probably for the best, you know? Independence. Taking control of your life. And, hey, if you need anything, you can always come to Joey. Me and Chandler live right across the hall. And he's away a lot. Joey, stop hitting on her. It's her wedding day. What? Like there's a rule or something? [INTERCOM BUZZES] Please don't do that again. It's a horrible sound. PAUL: Uh, it's Paul. - Buzz him in. - Who's Paul? - Paul, the wine guy, Paul? Maybe. Wait a minute. Your "not a real date" is with Paul, the wine guy? - He finally asked you out? - Yes. Ooh. This is a "Dear Diary" moment.

chunk_00009.subtitles: Rach, wait, I can cancel. Please, no. Go, I'll be fine. Ross, are you okay? I mean, do you want me to stay? That'd be good. - Really? - No, go on! It's Paul, the wine guy. [KNOCKING ON DOOR] MONICA: Hi, come in. Paul, this is... ...everybody. Everybody, this is Paul. JOEY: Paul, the wine guy. - Wine guy. - I didn't catch your name. Paul, was it? - Okay. Sit down. Two seconds. - Okay. [MOUTHING] Ooh, I just pulled out four eyelashes. That can't be good. So, Rachel, what are you up to tonight? Well, I was supposed to be headed for Aruba on my honeymoon... ...so, nothing. Right. You're not even getting your honeymoon. God. No, no. Although, Aruba. Heh. This time of year? Eh. Talk about your...

Monica’s apartment living room — daytime, natural window light mixed with indoor lighting. The space is cluttered with furniture assembly materials and tools.

Rachel Green: white off-the-shoulder dress - pearl necklace - long, brown, wavy hair - expression shifts from concerned to annoyed
Chandler Bing: dark leather jacket - dark shirt underneath - dark, medium-length hair - expression: relaxed, smiling
Joey Tribbiani: white short-sleeved shirt with dark vest - blue jeans - dark, medium-length hair - expression: animated, talking
Phoebe Buffay: denim vest over a patterned top - long, blonde, straight hair - expression: confused, gesturing

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Ross stands in the kitchen area holding a bottle, talking to Rachel who is seated at a table. Chandler and Joey enter from the background, standing near the refrigerator. Phoebe enters from the right, holding a tool, and begins talking to Ross. Ross then moves to the living room area where Chandler and Joey are assembling furniture, crouching down to examine a wooden frame and blueprints. Joey and Chandler stand near the furniture, discussing the assembly while Ross remains seated on the floor.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Wooden furniture frame: light-colored (on floor)
- Blueprints: white paper (held by Ross)

- Lamp: yellow patterned shade (on floor)
- Refrigerator: white (in background)
- Poster: "The Speed Racer Show" (on wall)
- Potted plant: green (in corner)
- Boxes: cardboard (on floor)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses furniture assembly with Chandler and Joey, who are helping him. The conversation has a casual, slightly humorous tone, with Ross appearing focused and Chandler smiling. Rachel reacts with annoyance to Ross’s actions, while Phoebe appears confused and gestures while talking to Ross.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**

Phoebe enters the frame from the right side.
Ross moves from the kitchen area to the living room floor.
Chandler and Joey shift positions while assembling furniture.
chunk_00010.subtitles: Talk about your... ...big lizards. Anyway, if you don't feel like being alone tonight... ...Joey and Chandler are helping me with my furniture. Yes, and we're very excited about it. Actually, thanks, but I'm just gonna hang out here tonight. - It's been a long day. - Oh, sure. Okay. Sure. Hey, Pheebs, you wanna help? Oh, I wish I could, but I don't want to. I'm supposed to attach a bracket-y thing to the side things... ...using a bunch of these little worm guys. I have no bracket-y thing, I see no worm guys whatsoever... ...and I cannot feel my legs. What's this? I have no idea. - Done with the bookcase. - All finished.

chunk_00011.subtitles: - Done with the bookcase. - All finished. This was Carol's favorite beer. She always drank it out of the can. I should have known. Hey. Ross, let me ask you a question. She got the furniture, the stereo, the good TV. What did you get? You guys. - Oh, God. Oh, my God. - You got screwed. - Oh, my God. - I know, I know. I'm such an idiot. I should've caught on when she went to the dentist four and five times a week. I mean, how clean can teeth get? My brother's going through that. He's such a mess. How did you get through it? He might try accidentally breaking something valuable of hers. - Say her... - Leg? Heh. That's one way of going through it, yeah. Me, I went for the watch. - You actually broke her watch? - Mm. Barry, I'm sorry. I am so sorry. You probably think it's about making love with your socks on, but it isn't.
chunk_00011.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

chunk_00012.caption:
### **SCENE SETTING:**
Monica’s apartment living room — evening, warm lamp lighting. The setting includes a couch with colorful pillows, a globe on a side table, and a green door in the background.

### **CHARACTERS PRESENT:**
Rachel Green: light pink button-up shirt - blue jeans - long, wavy brown hair - animated expression
Ross Geller: red button-up shirt - light-colored pants - short, dark hair - concerned expression
Chandler Bing: dark t-shirt - blue jeans - medium-length brown hair - animated expression
Joey Tribbiani: white polo shirt with dark vest - blue jeans - short, dark hair with cap - neutral expression

### **ACTIONS AND INTERACTIONS:**
Rachel stands in the living room, talking on a walkie-talkie while gesturing with her free hand. Ross enters from the kitchen holding a beer can and speaks animatedly to Chandler, who is also holding a beer can and has his arm around Ross. Joey stands nearby, holding a hammer and looking on with a neutral expression.

### **OBJECTS AND PROPS:**
- Walkie-talkie: black (held by Rachel)
- Beer cans: blue (held by Ross, Chandler, and Joey)
- Globe: on side table (background)
- Couch: with colorful pillows (background)
- Green door: visible in background
- Poster: "The Speed Racer Show" (visible behind Joey)

### **DIALOGUE CONTEXT:**
Ross discusses the concept of "one woman for everybody" with Chandler, who responds with a humorous analogy about ice cream flavors. The conversation has a casual, joking tone, with Ross appearing animated and Chandler reacting with a smirk. Rachel is engaged in a separate phone conversation, unaware of the men’s discussion.

### **TEMPORAL NOTES:**
Rachel moves from standing near the couch to walking toward the kitchen area while talking on the walkie-talkie.
Ross enters the frame from the kitchen doorway.
Chandler moves from the kitchen counter to stand beside Ross.
Joey remains stationary in the kitchen area throughout the clip.
chunk_00012.subtitles: You probably think it's about making love with your socks on, but it isn't. It isn't, it's about me. And I... [SIGHS] Hi. Machine cut me off again. Anyway... You know what's scary? What if there's only one woman for everybody? I mean, what if you get one woman, and that's it? Unfortunately, in my case, there was only one woman for her. What are you talking about? One woman. That's like saying there's only one flavor of ice cream for you. Let me tell you something, Ross. There's lots of flavors out there. There's rocky road and cookie dough and bing cherry vanilla. You can get them with jimmies or nuts or whipped cream. This is the best thing that ever happened to you. You got married. You were like, what, 8? Welcome back to the world. Grab a spoon.
chunk_00012.episode: 1x01 - The One Where Monica Gets A Roommate

chunk_00013.subtitles: Welcome back to the world. Grab a spoon. I honestly don't know if I'm hungry or horny. Then stay out of my freezer. Ever since she walked out on me, I... What? What? You wanna spell it out with noodles? No, it's more of a fifth date kind of revelation. Oh, so there's gonna be a fifth date? Isn't there? Yeah, yeah. I think there is. What were you gonna say? Well... Er, uh... Ever since she left me, um... ...I haven't been able to perform... ...sexually. Oh, God! Oh, God! I am so... - I'm so sorry. - It's okay. Being spit on is probably not what you need right now. Um...

chunk_00014.subtitles: How long? Two years. Wow! I'm glad you smashed her watch. So you still think you might want that fifth date? Yeah. Yeah, I do. I, Joanie, take you, Charles, as my lawful husband. MINISTER: Do you take Joanie...? - Oh! See. But Joanie loved Chachi. That's the difference. "Grab a spoon." Do you know long it's been since I grabbed a spoon? Do the words, "Billy, don't be a hero," mean anything to you? You know, here's the thing. chunk_00018.subtitles: - Hey, Monica. - Hey, Franny. Welcome back. How was Florida? You had sex, didn't you? How do you do that? - So, who? - You know Paul? Paul, the wine guy? Oh, yeah, I know Paul. You mean, you know Paul like I know Paul? Are you kidding? I take credit for Paul. Before me, there was no snap in his turtle for two years. Of course it was a line. Why? Why would anybody do something like that? We're looking for an answer more sophisticated than: "To get you into bed." Is it me? Is it like I have some sort of beacon that only dogs... ...and men with severe emotional problems can hear? All right, come here. Give me your feet.

chunk_00019.subtitles: I just thought he was nice, you know? I can't believe you didn't know it was a line. Guess what. - You got a job? - Are you kidding? I'm trained for nothing. I was laughed out of 12 interviews today. Yet you're surprisingly upbeat. Well, you would be too if you found Joan and David boots on sale... ...50 percent off. Oh, how well you know me. They're my new "I don't need a job or my parents. I've got great boots" boots. - How'd you pay for them? - Uh, credit card. And who pays for that? Um, my father. You can't live off your parents your whole life. I know that. That's why I was getting married. Give her a break. It's hard being on your own for the first time. - Thank you. - You're welcome.

chunk_00020.subtitles: - Thank you. - You're welcome. I remember when I first came to this city, I was 14. My mom had killed herself and my stepdad was back in prison. And I got here, and I didn't know anybody. I ended up living with this albino guy who was cleaning windshields... ...outside Port Authority. And then he killed himself. And then I found aromatherapy. So believe me, I know exactly how you feel. The word you're looking for is: "Anyway..." All right. You ready? - I don't think so. ROSS: Oh, come on. Cut. Cut. ALL: Cut, cut, cut. ROSS: Hey. MONICA: All right. Welcome to the real world. It sucks. You're gonna love it. [FRANCIS SCOTT KEY'S "STAR-SPANGLED BANNER" PLAYS ON TV] Well, that's it. You gonna crash on the couch?
